page.title: 19FORD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: FORD PARISH CHURCH From the porch of this ancient church parishioners have,for eight hundred years,enjoyed the view across the valley floor to the heights of the Cheviot Hills.Here are the tombstones of their forbears and near the door those of Lady Waterford and the first Lord Joicey,two of their most notable benefactors. The gloom of the interior is relieved by light from several stained glass windows with one depicting its patron saint, St.Michael,slaying the dragon. The stone pulpit was installed to mark Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee. Its surrounding statuettes show some of the apostles. There are 50 pews which provide seating for 300 people.
